channel.title: Anti-loggout
channel.description: in need of a script to keep me logged in...does not have to do much just move the cursor a little bit at random! no clicks are needed just need to stay logged in while fishing and other things :)

item.title: Anti-loggout
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

The problem was with the Duplicate Identifier error, was that previous versions of SRL had that already included, so you get Duplicate, which means that there are two and they always have to be a different name

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-loggout
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“roboroofer, post:21, topic:221906”]ok it works thank you very much !!

2 final questions

1.const
Secs = 30; //Seconds until the mouse is moved.
SecUM = 45; //Seconds in which the Mouse is inactive?

dont these do the same thing? and is it detectable when it moves every 45 seconds every time?

2.can it be adjusted to move just 1 to 2 pixels?[/quote]

  1. No they’re not the same. The first one is the wait period between moving the mouse, and the second one is the period to wait until the mouse is inactive (e.g If the mouse is inactive for 5 seconds, it’ll move the mouse every 3 seconds. etc). And i have added randomness in the wait period, so it is un-detectable.

  2. It can do that, but learn to script and do it yourself

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-loggout
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“roboroofer, post:19, topic:221906”]error line 9 duplicate identifier ‘x’ in script?

this one is my fault i think im using old version scar 2.3 …srl 3.7
if this wrong what version should i be using?[/quote]
Well duh! You’re supposed to be using the Latest SCAR Version and the Latest SRL Version, hence the undetectability. Download SCAR from here and learn how to setup Subversion here.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-loggout
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“roboroofer, post:17, topic:221906”]error (line 13 comma expected in script)

i have searched for the comma fix can’t find anything[/quote]
Dw, another bracket was expected. Here, try this one, it should work (haven’t tested):[code]{.include SRL\SRL.scar}

const
Secs = 1; //Seconds until the mouse is moved.
SecUM = 5; //Seconds in which the Mouse is inactive?

var
b, c: Boolean;
x, y, MIT: Integer;

begin
SetupSRL;
MarkTime(MIT);
repeat
GetMousePos(x, y);
if(not(((x>x) or (x<x)) or ((y>y) or (y<y)))) then
if(GetTimeRunning-(SecUM1000)>GetTimeRunning-TimeFromMark(MIT)) then
repeat
Wait(Secs1000+Random((Secs*1000)/2));
MMouse(MSX1, MSY1, MSX2+1, MSY2+1);
if(IsFKeyDown(2)) then
b:=True;
Until(b);
Until(b);
end.[/code]

And once it starts moving the mouse, you’ll have to press F2 to stop it

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-loggout
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“roboroofer, post:15, topic:221906”]ok 2 things first there’s an error (line 9 comma expected in script)

and second is there a way to make the script run idle untill the mouse has not moved for (X) amount of seconds?[/quote]
Umm, ok, hold on.

Ok, well here’s a better version of that script i had posted above:[code]{.include SRL\SRL.scar}

const
Secs = 1; //Seconds until the mouse is moved.

var
b: Boolean;

begin
repeat
if(IsFKeyDown(2)) then
repeat
Wait(Secs1000+Random((Secs1000)/2);
MMouse(MSX1, MSY1, MSX2+1, MSY2+1);
if(IsFKeyDown(2)) then
b:=True;
Until(IsFKeyDown(2));
Until(b);
end.[/code]

I’ll work on the other one right away

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-loggout
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:12, topic:221906”]begin
repeat
clickmouse(123+random(50),456+random(50));
wait(20000+random(10000);
until(false)
end.

??[/quote]
Forgot the True or False parametre Besides, don’t use it otherwise you’ll get banned.

Ok, now i think i know what you need to do (Press F2 to start and F2 to stop and enter the amount of seconds to wait before moving ;)):[code]{.include SRL\SRL.scar}

const
Secs = 1; //Seconds until the mouse is moved.

begin
if(IsFKeyDown(2)) then
repeat
Wait(Secs1000+Random((Secs1000)/2);
MMouse(MSX1, MSY1, MSX2+1, MSY2+1);
Until(IsFKeyDown(2));
end.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-loggout
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

O…k.

Press F1 to stop :[code]
{.include SRL\SRL.scar}

begin
repeat
MMouse(MSX1, MSY1, MSX2+2, MSY2+2);
Wait(100+Random(101));
Until(IsFKeyDown(1));
end.[/code]

Read full topic
